page.title: 13THE ECOLOGY OF RUNCORN
page.content: {2.Wasteland: {Stenhills.}Formerly a sandstone quarry the area at Castle Rise was used as a refuse tip.Halton Borough Council own the tip area, the remainder is owned by Warrington and Runcorn Development Corporation.The soil is sandy with some sandstone outcrops.There are a good variety of plants.We counted 70 species of flowering plant divided as follows:13 grasses,2 trees,5 shrubs, 55 herbs,1 fern,1 moss and 1 horsetail.Grasses and herbs are dominant with gorse dominant on the sandstone outcrops.The variation in vegetation is the result of several influences.One may be the depth of soil and the type of soil used with refuse to infill the quarry.Another may be the lighting of fires on the site. {
